sources.title: Secret Mission
sources.description: “Wartime action, drama, comedy and romance” “A bit less than routine” “Complete twaddle” (IMDB reviews quotes). A far-fetched and haphazard espionage thriller that implied the Germans were so gullible and incompetent they would be easy to defeat. Even as a home front morale booster it must have been hard to swallow in bomb-ravaged London and Coventry. Good cast and production. IMDB rating 5.4. Directed by Harold French. Released in 1942 (UK only). Complete print (PAL transfer). A.K.A. “Secret Service”

sources.title: Secret Mission
sources.description: Title: Secret Mission Summary: Three British spies and a French resistance fighter sneak into occupied France to gather information about the German forces for a planned invasion. Directed by: Harold French Actors: Hugh Williams, James Mason, Carla Lehmann Production Company: Excelsior Films Release Date: 5 October 1942 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Three British spies and a French resistance fighter sneak into occupied France to gather information about the German forces for a planned invasion.

metadata.Plot: Three British spies and a French resistance fighter sneak into occupied France to gather information about the German forces for a planned invasion.
